message.content:
cs.AR, cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.SY, cs.SE

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper investigates the feasibility of DoS attacks on shared caches in multicore platforms and proposes an OS-level solution to prevent such attacks. This falls under the domain of computer architecture.
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper deals with security issues related to shared caches in multicore platforms and proposes a solution to prevent DoS attacks. This falls under the domain of cryptography and security.
- cs.OS (Operating Systems): The proposed solution to prevent DoS attacks involves extending a state-of-the-art memory bandwidth regulation mechanism in the OS. This falls under the domain of operating systems.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper deals with the analysis and prevention of DoS attacks on shared caches in multicore platforms, which involves system-level considerations such as hardware structure and OS-level mechanisms. This falls under the domain of systems and control.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The proposed solution to prevent DoS attacks involves implementing the mechanism in Linux on a real multicore platform. This involves software engineering considerations such as implementation and testing.
